byline.contributor: Nicholas Fandos reported from Woodbridge, and Christine Hauser from New York.
byline.original: By NICHOLAS FANDOS and CHRISTINE HAUSER

abstract: Thousands of people gather at chapel in Woodbridge, Va, to honor Prince William County Police Officer Ashley Guindon, 29, who was shot and killed while investigating domestic disturbance on her first day on job; suspected killer, Ronald W Hamilton, has been arrested on murder charges.

headline.print_headline: Officers Mourn a Virginia Colleague Gunned Down on Her First Day on the Job
headline.main: Thousands Honor Virginia Officer Killed on Her First Day on the Job

keywords.value: National Law Enforcement Officers Memorial Fund
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: Officer Ashley Guindon of the Prince William County police was remembered for her work with soup kitchens, suicide prevention programs and mortuary services for Marines.
lead_paragraph: Officer Ashley Guindon of the Prince William County police was remembered for her work with soup kitchens, suicide prevention programs and mortuary services for Marines.
